Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kuberan
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with helpful staff. The rooms are a little small but this is expected in most mid-ranged Paris hotels. The hotel is less than 400 meters from the RER and Metro. The only thing is that it is on line 3 and normally you have to do 1 or 2 changes to go anywhere of real interest (well to me that is). The elevator was so tinny that it was a joke to read that it has a maximum capacity of 4 persons. One person and a large bag is all that could fit in there. Must be measured with 4 slim Parisian women in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Estes08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent base for our trip to Paris. It is in an architecturally interesting area of Paris, near the metro and the RER and within walking distance to some of the cities many sights. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and plentiful and the free internet was fast and available in the rooms as well as the lobby. The hotel is also near some great cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful neighborhood and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Julie G
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in this neighborhood with real parisians, grocery stores, and markets. People were very kind and patient with us because it wasnt tourist-central, someone came out of an office to help when we were lost and standing in front of their shop with a map. We found wonderful markets and pastry shops, where we bought bakery treats to have for breakfast the next day. This was a typical European-sized hotel (similar to NYC) but the full-tub/shower was a nice surprise. The elevator, safe and A/C were really important to us and were helpful. The Plaza du Marechal Juin, 1 block away, has the RER & Metro stations to anywhere you need to go and many great restaurants with people watching. It was a wonderful place to come home to after a busy day in the city sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this at the last minute as it was one of the few hotels available. It's not exactly near anything, but there's a great pâtisserie nearby (Les Enfants Gâtés, one of Christophe Michelak's favorites), and Paris is small anyway. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and the room big enough to swing a, well, let's not get the ASPCA up in arms and a stuffed animal in. Would recommend, especially if you've got business in the 16e, as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal here at Christmas time and the room was fantastic. It is located a ways outside the city centre but there is a Metro/RER station within a 5 minute walk. The staff were amazingly helpful and let us check-in early and check out a little late. Very nice room and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we were touring paris, so we stayed in diffrent hotels in paris and surroundings. me and my friend had a wonderfull stay at this hotel. the staff was very friendly and helpfull. the hotel is situated in a nice area and it is quiet neighborhood. the metro and railwaystation are nearby. there are also a lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Farhi23
Reviews.Content: Very charming and romantic hotel in Paris. The area is very quite. The stuff is very polite and helpfull and the breakfast buffet is very nice. The room was very clean and nicely decorated, the fact is that it is small did not disturb us.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: alwayslovinglife2012
Reviews.Content: The staff here were always helpful and friendly. Hotel rooms were small but always very clean & tidy. This is a cosy and beautifully decorated hotel. It's well located. Only 200 metres to the metro station and about a 30 minute casual walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees. We were very happy with our stay at this hotel. The price seemed high but I guess thats what you need to pay to get a decent place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: quite area to live in , taxis max charge 10 to 12 Euro from tourist attraction, excellent services from the staff,Excellent beds and comfortable to sleep in, I loved it so much, thanks hotel de nueville , you made my visit to Paris pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lazydaysWales
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel located out of the tourist hustle in a pleasant neighbourhood. 10-15 min walk from Arc de Triomphe, 15 min train ride from Eiffel Tower. Good choice of bistros less than 5 min walk (near the Metro). Fair room size for Paris, very clean, slept soundly due to comfortable bed and soundproofed rooms. We didn't try the air con as we preferred to sleep with the windows wide open - minimal traffic noise. Our towels were changed daily (without us needing to ask) and bed linen was changed on request. We would definitely return if visiting Paris again. The hotel has the smallest lift I have ever seen - suggest you put your case in and walk up the stairs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The desk clerks were very kind. For every question, they had a polite and useful answer. Their suggestions corresponded to what we had asked for. The choice for breakfast was large and the personal was very, very courteous. The only service which didn't really work was the change of the towels. Despite the card on the bed saying that we would like to change the towels, we still found the same at our return. But all in all, we had a nice stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just outside the busy tourist sections of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the Arch de Triumph in a fairly quiet residential neighborhood. It was nice to retreat back to this area after busy days sight-seeing. The metro is about 4 blocks away located in a square with many cafes and brasseries. The rooms are small, but clean. The breakfast was good. The hotel staff was outstanding--very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility. Leo was so kind, helpful and patient with my group. We had a beautiful view from our room of Paris. Location was perfect as was the neighborhood where we had many wonderful cafe's to choose from for our meals. The location was also perfect for the metro. We rode the metro daily and when we needed a cab Leo was kind to arrange service for us. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fox18
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my 6th trip to Paris. The Hotel de Neuville is definitely my favorite hotel in the city. On previous visits, I had come to Paris on business trips with my husband. This time, I returned to Paris for sightseeing with 5 of my friends. They also loved the hotel. The hotel has a charming, traditional feel, but it features all of the necessary modern conveniences. Located in the 17th arrondisment , it is not far away from the Champs-Elysées and the Arc de Triomphe. It is conveniently located near the métro, bus, and RER. There are many lovely little restaurants within walking distance. Leo, the hotel manager, is knowledgable and extremely helpful. His friendly manner made our visit absolutely perfect! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, thoroughly pleased with the Hotel Neuvill Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only issue, with this stay, was the noise from the street. next time I will request a higher room to mute some of the noise from the daycare across the street, the ambulances, mopeds and the occasional drunks partying in the park across the street

Reviews.Title: “Best Western De Neuville Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights - the first night there was a 'problem' guest in the room next to mine - music blaring really loudly, then shouting until 1am and then the television volume at a really unacceptable level. I phoned the reception 3 times - the first two times the receptionist said he'd contacted the person in the room - but obviously to no avail. When at 2.30am the problem still wasn't resolved and I asked the receptionist to call the police - he managed to find another room for me. I understand this wasn't the hotel's fault - they can hardly choose the guests they have to stay - but as a result I ended up with 3.5 hours sleep. For the rest of the stay there were no other problems. The room itself was really small - even by Paris standards - although nicely decorated. The bathroom had a separate toilet on the other side of the room - apart from being rather inconvenient - it was completely minute - and not - I'd expect - a 'one size fits all'. For the price we paid per night - I'd expect my pyjamas to at least be folded and not screwed up and thrown on the pillow as they were until I commented on this to the reception staff. Also toiletries and towels were not replaced. The location was lovely - really residential but enough restaurants/bars/cafes to have a choice. The area was 'calm' and quiet and the hotel was less than a 3 minute walk to the local RER station. To sum up -although in a nice area - I wouldn't stay at this hotel again out of choice. For the price- the service just wasn't up to scratch - the rooms were very small and I don't think the quality justified the cost.

Reviews.Title: “it is always a pleasure to arrive in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is cosy and pleople are very friendly . The rooms are small but with everything inside. People at breakfast are nice . Cleanig is ok. For me, it is very convenient because when I come to Paris visiting my daughter, leaving just in front of the hotel, The people of the hotel arrange always some special conditions . and I feel really at Home.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay for tourists with a taste for solid traditions in a charming milieu”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An hotel really of the old school, of the right kidney! And still a very modern one with all the conveniences, operated by a young friendly team! If you are looking for an original place to stay in Paris which is not far away from Champs-Elysées and the Arc de Triomphe, beautifully situated in the cosy 17th arrondisment and with excellent communications -métro, bus, RER- on a stone´s throw from your "headquarters" the Neuveville, don´t miss this oasis in the bubbling sea of the Paris life ! And remark : Despite of so many merits, the Neuveville with it´s 23 charming rooms is really worth the money. Finally -certainly not a disadvantage- there are a lot of genuiine bistrots and restaurants nearby, even those budget-priced!

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location ,very quiet. Friendly staf , they provide good information . Metro and RER near (200 m) , easy acces to Paris. A lot of restaurant in the area. Good internet conexion ( free wi-fi). Acceptable breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that delivered on all its promises. The breakfast that was included was great and a wonderful start to each day. The staff go out of their way to accommodate any requests and were very helpful with booking our wonderful river boat dinner cruise, our shuttle to the airport and even helped us find a place to do laundry in the neighborhood. The location is a quiet area and close to the Metro, the train, and many restaurants/cafes in the neighborhood. Thank you to all the staff, as the service was consistent with all staff from the front desk, to the room attendants, to the breakfast servers. Their attitudes and willingness to help were part of making our time in Paris most memorable. Loved the elevator :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris and The Best de Neuville hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Best Western de Neuville is beautifule hotel in Paris. We had a pleasant time at the hotel. We will visit this hotel again next time in Paris. Location, servis, value and our rooms were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo_Marques
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with space and very well presented. Good breakfast and very friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in great location in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: lianne_sa
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in August 2009 but it wouldn't let me put that date as it's quite a while ago - we have done quite a few city breaks in the last few years and felt that the hotels we have stayed at deserved reviews. (I'm 28 and my boyfriend is 36) The rooms were lovely and clean and all of the staff were very friendly! The miniature lift was ace - we still managed to get the two of us in it together with our travel cases was more amusing how small it was!! We could see the Sacré-Coeur from our room it was quite far in the distance but we were happy we could see one of the famous landmarks out of our building - we were at the front of the hotel on the top floor. The room was simple but adequate as we spent most of our time enjoying Paris so to us the room isn't the most important thing! As long as it looks modern and is comfy and clean we're happy!! The bar staff were very accommodating we could have a couple of drinks at the hotel bar when we got back to the hotel after being out for a meal late in Paris - which seems to be the thing to do out there we found ourselves eating at around 10 was when the restaurants were really buzzing!! Would recommend to any couples!! had a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and oh.. yes, service!”
Reviews.Author: jpmorgan
Reviews.Content: A last minute booking brought very pleasant surprises. The hotel is small, tucked away in a residential neighbourhood, close to metro, bus and everything that makes Paris so wonderful. The front desk, breakfast room and housekeeping staff are generally friendly, helpful and somewhat knowledgeable. It's easy to like this place, there are no less than 10 restaurants within a comfortable walking distance, you can stroll to the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe and always look forward to coming back to this hotel. One word of warning. Do not take room 1, it is dark and claustrophobic. Good for one night stay but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarkAddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The hotel seemed to provide everything we wanted for our stay in Paris and it wasn't too expensive. The rooms are clean and big for a city and the staff were very helpful (Thanks Eric). We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel but ate at one of the places near the metro for about 12 Euros. It was easy to get around Paris because of the Metro and we bought a 3 day ticket for zones 1, 2 and 3. The hotel is very close to the Pereire metro station and Pereire Levallois RER. It is easy to get there from CDG airport. We took the RER B from Terminal 2, direction city centre and got off at Gare du Nord. From there we took the metro, line 2, direction Porte Dauphine and get off at Villiers. Then we took metro line 3, direction Pont de Levallois Becon. When you exit Pereire metro station, turn left and head towards Boulevard Pereire, walking past the RER, turn right by the Buffalo Grill. The hotel is a few hundred yards on your left. Would definately stay there again if visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ottosmome330
Reviews.Content: A French co-worker of mine recommended the location for this hotel for our trip to Paris. The Best Western hotel de Neuville was in a residential neighborhood but was a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysse. The price of the hotel was perfect and was at least 45% cheaper than hotels that were 5 or 10 blocks closer to the Arc. The room was ready for us when we arrived (around 11am when check in was at 3pm) which was really appreciated. We received plenty of maps and guide tours. We choose not to have breakfast included because we wanted to eat at the local pattissieres and such. The room was big for a European hotel. Large King size bed. Windows that opened all the way. We had a great view of a place. It was quiet at night with plenty of fresh air through the windows. The elevator literally fits 1 person and barely 1 piece of luggage. I had to sit on my suitcase in order to make it in the elevator. My husband took the stairs with his luggage. The bathroom was clean but the only issue was that they didn't provide wash cloths. Hairdryer was great so no need to bring one along (like i did). There is a bar in the lobby that has plenty of liquor and 3 kinds of beer (Kroneburg, Heinkein and Carlsburg). Pasqual was on duty our first night of our stay and he amazed us with some great stories about being a Parisian living in Lousiana with his wife (now ex wife). He made our stay at Neuville memorable!!! The hotel arranged a shuttle service to Charles de Gaulle on the morning of our flight home. The staff were friendly and unobtrusive. The wifi was free in the room which was great! I would definitely stay in this hotel when we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well maintained hotel with decent staff”
Reviews.Author: Oscail
Reviews.Content: PROS: 3 mins walk to metro and RER. It looks like a lot of stops on the metro to the centre of the action but most stops are less than one minute apart Very pleasant staff with good language skills Well maintained and clean rooms. Free W-fi in rooom or free use of pc in small but comfortable lobby Several bistros/brasseries nearby. (not very touristy) 24 room service (although the prices are very high) Quiet street. Cons; Cost of breakfast is high at €15 No fridge in room (was mostly -2 degrees when I was there so I kept cold stuff outside on my enclosed window ledge) The lift. It's not really a con, it's just hilariously small. General: I got a double room for an average of €75 per night in January. This was by booking and paying a few months in advance. The rate went up to €110 per night a few weeks before my arrival. Was pretty satisfied with the hotel but don't think i would have paid €110 per night on a room only basis. Consider the book/pay in early option for the best rate. Its a good, solid hotel with staff that understand service.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Short Stay I've Had”
Reviews.Author: Maerdydd
Reviews.Content: Fabulous town house hotel. Beautifully renovated. So charming. I thought travelling to Paris in the winter would be a bad thing but the hotel was just so in keeping with everything Parisian I'd ever imagined. People have commented on the small lift and it IS small but it added to the completely charming atmosphere in the hotel. People have also complained about the price of the breakfast but each morning I had fruit, ham, eggs, sausage, fresh bread, yoghurt and cheese, washed down with a pot of tea so I don't understand what there was to complain about! The staff were pleasant and helpful and even tolerated my school girl French on which we got by over the full four days. The Conciege was a dream and even took my postcards for me. A beautiful restaurant was at the end of the road and the hotel was within striking distance of some lovely eateries and all the main roads leading to the Arc De Triomphe. The room was of a good size with one of the most comfortable beds. Seperate toilet from the bathroom and the bath was easily large enough to allow me to soak away the walk each day. The view from the room wasn't the best but the Conciege said if we returned we would be welcome to have one of the uppermost rooms which would afford us a good view of the city skyline. All in all the hotel added completely to the whole charm that was Paris and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: meganlupin
Reviews.Content: We stayed a little less than a week here and loved it. The room was small, but clean and comfortable, which is all you need! The staff were very nice, helpful, and friendly. The hotel is located in the 17th arrondissement, a little bit out of the city, but is on both a Metro and an RER line, which are easy to navigate and take you anywhere you need to go. The neighborhood is nice, an upscale residential area with parks, cafes, restaurants, and shops nearby. There is a park right outside, a school across the street, and a tennis club down the street. These all quiet down at night. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes down the street from the hotel - all price ranges and tastes. We tried most of them and they were good. Most of them are arranged around a rotary and you can sit outside, have a drink, and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Would really recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMcCHarrogate
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive things in recent review of hotel. Rooms smallish but pleasant - sound proofing not brilliant but clean and well looked after- free WiFi is a big plus. Staff very pleasant (and mostly English speaking). Lift hysterical but usable. Breakfast overpriced at 15 Euros - go to one of the nearby cafes. Location very good - handy for metro and RER - both fairly easy to use - station also had helpful English speaking staff. Walking distance to Arc de Triomphe. Local restaurants also good and plentiful

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: JennyT2009
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT little hotel with wonderful staff and everything you could possibly expect from a hotel in this price range (though the lift is indeed a thing to behold). Our only concern upon arriving was parking as even though there are parking spaces just outside the hotel, all of them were taken. We eventually managed to find a space though and were pleased to discover that parking is free from 7 pm-8 (9?) am and all day Saturday and Sunday - a blessing if you don't want to fork out 20 Euro plus for 24 hour parking at the nearby parking structure. (If you have a Blue Badge, then bear in mind that unlike in England, as long as you're parked on the street in a Blue Badge zone, there's no limit as to how long you can stay there.) Yet another bonus is that there's a laptop in the lounge and, if I interpreted the sign correctly, complementary wireless access (a saving of another 20 Euro a day, in comparison with most of the Paris hotels). One final note - the lack of decent towels mentioned in other reviews. Well, I'm happy to report that the hotel has recently purchased new ones - we were told this by the receptionist when we mentioned the fact that this was the only negative thing we'd seen written about the hotel to date - so NO need to take your own. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: norwichharris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 emjoyable nights here. The hotel is easy to find, with the Periere (line 3) metro stop very near (3 minutes dragging cases once you get off). Once you get inside, the staff are incredibly polite and helpful. One tip is that if you want to practice your french, let them know, otherwise they will switch to embarassingly perfect english. All the waiters in the cafes were fluent, and can spot l'anglais by the fact that we hesitate to read the menu (I asked in the end). The room was cosy, quite adequate in size. It was very clean and well decorated, with a view over a square with Sacre Coeur in the distance. At night it was quiet, and never felt unsafe. Take a moment to review the "extreme parking" in the area. The breakfast in the hotel is pleasant, but at 15 euros each a bit steep. Don't expect a full English, as this isn't Yorkshire. Better (and cheaper) can be found at the cafes nearby, or one of the boulangeries. Prices vary wildly, yet most offer a fixed price breakfast of a pastry, coffee and fruit juice. If you want tea and coffee making stuff at the hotel they will provide you with a kettle etc on request. As others have said, it is walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, but the metro is very easy to use to get to other places too. We bought 20 single tickets from a machine when we arrived. As others have mentioned, the lift is hilarious. If there is room for 4 people in it, they must be leprechauns, but at a pinch it'll do 2 people + bags. To sum up, it isn't crammed full of french character, but it is a clean, pleasant, cheap hotel with friendly staff in a safe area. If you want culture, get out there and find it!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: stuiedo
Reviews.Content: many positives about this hotel. Location: Location is not in the city centre (hence the cheaper price!), and the location is more residential. but its still near enough to the attractions. A Metro stop is round the corner and its only a 15 minute walk and your at the Arc de Triumphe. Due to the residential location it is very quite at night, no loud noises at all, didnt see anyone at all on the Saturday night! If you come out of the hotel turn right and walk to the roundabout there are cafe's and restaurants. I would recommend the Petit Bofinger for a very enjoyable meal. Make sure you get a window seat and marvel at the way Parisian motorists negotiate roundabouts! Our room was fine. Nothing amazing and a bit small, but was clean and had everything we needed. It wasnt an expensive hotel and you dont spend much time in your hotel in Paris so was perfectly fine for us. However, if its not included i probably wouldnt go for the breakfast. Its ok, but at 15 Euros its a bit expensive. you can go round the corner to a cafe and get a croissant, french bread and jam, orange juice and coffee for only 8 Euros. Reception staff are also very friendly. I would definatley recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room”
Reviews.Author: Danish H
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite remote, though safe. Police often round the area and we actually saw how quick the police surround 2 suspects in a matter of seconds. Convenient store is around the corner, with some restaurants for you to choose. Room is smelly although we requested non smoking room. We can see a lot of cigarette butts on the balcony's flower pot. Very dirty and unpleasant to sit nearby the window to enjoy fresh air. You can breathe in the cigarette smell. Even our jackets smell after been staying there for a week. Yucks. Front desk officers are impolite, and the bell boy was terrible. No greetings when we enter the hotel. No "bonjour" or "bonsoir"! Whatever happened to french gentleman?? Bell boy dragged our luggages in a rough manner. The hotel is quite far from tourist spots, and the nearest is Arc de Tromph. Be prepared to bring along the hotel address as not many taxi drivers know where is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Quite liked it...”
Reviews.Author: lin23
Reviews.Content: Actually, our room looked quite like the one on the website (the pink one :-) ). It wasn't big but was o.k. for Paris. Bathroom was spacious, with a bath tub, hairdrier, etc. Everything was clean. Receptionist was helpful with info and taxi, etc. We had no breakfast in the hotel, but in a bistro nearby and loved it. The hotel is in a neat living area, approx. 15-20 min. walk from Arc de Triomph (rue Wagram) and the metro and train station are handy as well. Overall, a very good experience - especially for the price we got over booking.net. The only negative issue to mention: the beds seem to be quite old and are not really comfortable anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaroleJR
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter at the Hotel de Neuville for 12 days and couldn't have been more pleased! The rooms are large by European standards and the staff was charming and very helpful. I liked that the hotel was not in the middle of tourist areas but that those same areas that were crowded were very close. There is a train station and Metro stop 5 minutes from the hotel and the little restaurants at the square up the street from the hotel are very nice and reasonably priced. I will definitely stay there again. I do have one word of warning however...ELEVATOR! If you're prepared, it's comical! It is so small and rickety. When you arrive, have one person in your party go up to your floor to receive the bags...you put them in the elevator and send them up. There is no room for both you and your bags or you and another person. If you aren't claustrophobic, you get over the lack of a spacious elevator quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the $”
Reviews.Author: TheCanadianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel.The standard room is very small but always clean. Helpfull staff. Not that close to any site but there's a RER at the end of the road (5 min. walk). It takes you directly to Eiffel. There you can take the RED BUS and go all over Paris for 22 euro/48h.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexFlash
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in June and was very pleasantly surprised. This was my third trip to Paris and I would definately book this hotel again. Parisien hotel rooms are notoriously small, but this was more spacious than most, and was scrupulously clean and well decorated with delightful character, and with friendly english speaking staff. The location was a two minute walk from the Metro, with the walk to the Arc de Triomphe only about 20 leisurely minutes. The area was pleasant and we felt quite comfortable making this walk back late in the evening. We found the breakfast facilities slightly lacking, but with a hatfull of bars and restaurants located around the nearest metro the aforemention 2 minutes walk away, this is never a problem in Paris. The only 'warning' I would make is avoid the lift if you are claustrophobic - it really is the smallest elevator wothy of the name - one person and one suitcase is the limit unless you enjoy playing 'sardines'! Overall, a fine recomendation for a romantic break as a base to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Very Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveClo
Reviews.Content: After reviewing hotels on your website - I found Hotel De Neuville.. My partner and I found this hotel to be of a very high standard. The rooms were a good size and the hotel was spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Very close to a metro station which will take you anywhere you need to go and also, for those driving, it is just off the Boulevard Peripherique - which is the main ring road around Paris and will get you anywhere you need to go to... I would highly recommend this hotel and would return, in fact I am booking this hotel for my return trip for the semi-final of the World Cup!!!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: dgirl365
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for new year and after trawling through the reviews on here we found the Neuville. The room was clean and the staff where very friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a great location to see the sites of Paris, with just a 2 minute walk to the metro where you could get to anywhere in Paris in a few minutes. There where also restaurants situated nearby which were lovely and the Arc de triumph was a 15 minute walk away - passing some great shops and cafes. All in all this was a great stay and they arranged all our travel back to the airport when we left Paris. A great hotel when it could be so easy to end up in a grotty pit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: SandraS
Reviews.Content: Last summer in Europe, my friends and I decided to go to Paris last minute, was not originally part of our plan. We got this hotel very cheap and LOVED it. There were about 10 of us, we each stayed 2 to a room. The front desk was extremely helpful and spoke English! The breakfast is really good and the lady is really helpful and sweet. We were in walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, The Arc de Triumphe and the Champs Elysees. There were great restaurants nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: geordieJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel for my 50th birthday. We booked the hotel on the strength of the reviews from this site and what can I say but it is a gem of a hotel. We had a fantastic stay with the friendliest reception staff that I have ever come across. The lady who oversees breakfast is lovely with a warm welcoming smile every morning. The rooms are small but very adequate our room was 17 on the first floor and had lovely views. When I go back to Paris this is where I will be staying. Thank you to all trip advisor reviewers who gave such a good report about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: MMOuellette
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION..... From our Balcony we saw the Eiffel Tower !! Walking distance... loved it... really sweet restaurants next door. Hotel DOES NOT have Airconditioning in the actual rooms, but does have airconditioning in the lobby!!! But putting that asside... great windows that open up to the balcony.... approximately a 10 min walk to the eiffel tower...Amazing Chinese restaurant a block a way

Reviews.Title: “An excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: IceColdCube
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just enjoyed four fantastic nights in Paris, staying at this lovely little hotel. Our room (no 26 on the second floor) was large enough for our needs and very tastefully furnished and decorated. It was also spotlessly clean, as was our nice little bathroom which had a great shower. Our bed was very comfortable and although my husband and I are quite tall we certainly had no problems with the length of the bed. We had a nice view out onto the pretty street outside – it was lovely to be able to open the widows up wide and take in the fresh air. We also found this hotel to be perfectly located for getting in and around Paris. The Periere metro station (and RER) is at just a couple of mins walk away - literally just at the end of the road. It also doesn’t take long to walk the pleasant local streets to the nearby Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees. The staff at this hotel are indeed very helpful and friendly, and they speak fluent English. We also enjoyed our breakfast every day. There was plenty of food on offer and no dirty dishes on display when we were there. The hot chocolate was, just as another reviewer has mentioned, fantastic, and, indeed, a great way to start the day! I am pretty hard to please but honestly cannot fault this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a decent place to stay in Paris at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kzngirl
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on lastminute for eurostar travel to and from Paris, including two nights at this hotel (b&b). The hotel is tucked away down a side street, about a five minute walk (or less) to an RER and Metro station, so very convenient for travelling into and around Paris. The receptionist was very friendly and extremely helpful - and also spoke fluent english which was a bonus. The lift on the way up to our room had us in hysterics: it has to be the smallest lift I have ever been on, it says max 4 people, I would like to see 3 try to fit in! We had a twin room, small but clean. The bathrooms are also small but again clean, nice towels and basic toiletries. We would have loved tea/coffee making facilities but none were to be had and the hotel charges 3.80 euro per pot of tea if you order it in the lobby. Breakfast was fabulous: very nice hostess and a huge spread of treats. I adored the hot chocolate and do recommend it. We had a choice of cereal, croissants, bread, pain au chocolat etc, with jams, honey etc, cold ham, hard boiled egg, cheeses, fruit and yoghurts. More than enough to keep you going until lunch, and even further if you take a wrapped madelaine or two with you upon leaving. We were allowed to leave our bags behind the reception desk after we checked out and they were kept safe and sound from 10 in the morning until 6pm that evening when we returned to collect them en route to Nord du Gard. Would definitely recommend this hotel as a cheap and cheerful b&b, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pleasantry
Reviews.Content: Well... after reading other reviews this place sounded loveley! My boyfriend and i decided on a 5 night break in Paris and when we arrived at the hotel we were given a room mmm... then another mmm... and then a third! I don't want to be a moaner but they are very small rooms and the beds are tiny! if you are over 6ft tall think again! both are legs hung over the ends and we didn't sleep well due to this. The bathrooms are very tiny, and towels are rough and tatty. The maid cleaned the room every day and failed to see the bottles under the bed that were there when we checked in. The positive side for this hotel is the staff are very pleasant and helpfull and the breakfast lady is sweet. The location of the hotel is great for getting anywhere and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. I have stayed in better standard B&B's than this! This is only my opinion and i will not stay here again. (sorry)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a Great price!!”
Reviews.Author: carlysparkle
Reviews.Content: Was thrilled to bits with this hotel! Paid £65 each for a 2 night stay through Lastminute, what a bargain!!!!! Near to the city centre, took my friend and I 15mins or so to walk to the Arc du Triumph/Champs Elysees - in fact we only got the metro once. The hotel is near to both the Pereire and Wagram metro stations, so it is very conveniently located. We took the Roissey bus from CDG airport to Paris Opera, then took the Metro from there to Wagram, which was by far cheaper than a taxi!!!! Breakfast was lovely, plenty of fruit, croissants, chocolate croissants, and danishes - no complaints there! The room was on the small side but then is normal for Paris so that is by no means a complaint - it was plenty big enough for my friend and I, as we were out all day. The hotel staff spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful - they even arranged a transfer for us to the airport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Petra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated somewhat outside of the city centre, but it has a subway station nearby that brings you there in 10/15 mintues. And if you feel like walking the Arc de Triomphe is only 20 minutes away.... This is the sixth hotel I have been to in Paris and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I paid cost only € 59 per night via booking.com. The rooms are rather small, but that's the case in all Paris hotels. It looked like it had been recently refurnished, everything was clean, there were no unpleasant smells, the beds were very comfortable and I wish I had a shower like that at home! Next time I will be in Paris I will definitely stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: momof3kiddos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple went to this hotel. We were celebrating my husband and my anniversary as well as both husbands birthdays. It was a great little room for a romantic get away. Rooms were extremely small, but I am told this is the standard for Paris. They were kept clean though and the air con in the room was excellent. The staff was very friendly and spoke English well. They also gave good tips on where to eat. But I would not book the open top bus tours through them because you can get it cheaper in town. The breakfast served there was pretty good as well. It is located a good walk from the center of Paris but there is a metro within a few minutes walking. I would probably stay a little more centrally located next time just to make it easier to go out to the sites, but as stated previously, it is not difficult to get around from the location just a little more out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMelton
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Neuville. The staff were lovely, professional and really helpful. The room was fairly small but well decorated in a hint of boudoir style, with a lovely big window that opened up to overlook the surrounding streets. The hotel was further out than I thought - lastminute.com said it was 2km from Gare du Nord, it was more like 10km. But it was very well located, right near a Metro stop than ran directly to the Eiffel tower and the shops. There are also some great restaurants a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. Although the hotel is not 5* luxury, it's clean, well maintained and, most importantly, has a calm welcoming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: plouni
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after thoroughly researching on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed! Ok we are not looking at the George V here but very good value for money and I have stayed in a few hotels in Paris over the years some of which were horrid. The hotel is situated in a rather upmarket area of town with metro and RER, bars and restaurants within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Ask for a high floor front facing room from which you get a distant view of the Sacre Coeur Baslica (pretty at night). Can get a little noisy in the square below but with windows closed (there is air-conditioning) there should be no problem. Room and bathroom were impeccably clean, not large but perfectly adequate. Front desk staff friendly and helpful particularly Susie. Breakfast consisted of cereals, yogurts, hams, cheeses, fruit juices and a nice selection of sweet and savoury pastries. More than enough to set you up for the morning's sightseeing. The breakfast lady is very sweet. For dinner we tried Ville Periere and Le Petit Bofinger both with typical french cuisine, the former did not have a set menu in the evening but the ambiance, food and service was good and worth paying that bit extra. Both these are at the roundabout where you can pick up transport links - right turn out of hotel. Buy your metro tickets at the booth in the station where the lady spoke very good english and advised us on the various ticket prices - we had a three day pass(valid on metro, RER (1-2 zones) buses and the funicular railway up to Sacre Coeur at metro stop Anvers. This was about 18 euros each. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little personable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieMcGov
Reviews.Content: We picked a winner. Enjoyed the pleasant personnel very helpful and friendly. The breakfast staff and food was great. Hotel room clean and comfortable . Great choice!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN De Neuville
HotelInfo.Address: 3 rue Verniquet, 75017 Paris, France
